result:
A) 0.0500

  • Question 177) In a given year, the federal revenue computers of a country identified as inconsistent 20% of the income tax statements sent to them. A statement is classified as inconsistent when it has some kind of error or conflict in the information provided. These statements considered inconsistent were analyzed by auditors, who found that 25% of them were fraudulent. It was also found that, among the statements that did not have inconsistencies, 6.25% were fraudulent.
